channel.title: Songbun and the five castes of North Korea

item.title: Songbun and the five castes of North Korea
item.author: Theo Jones
item.description: "The most important element in the social structure of Kim Il Sungâ€™s North Korea was the infamous songbun system. This system was established in the late 1950s and came into full power somewhere around 1967. It divides the population into groups, according to the actions and status of their paternal ancestor (and themselves, depending on their age) during the Japanese colonial period and the Korean War. Songbun determined, among other things, whether one was allowed to live in the capital or in special cities like Kaesong and later Rason, the workplace one is allocated and what kind of education one can receive."
